cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi E of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn north and north-northeast, tracking toward the north-central Gulf Coast with closest approach from southeast Louisiana to the Mississippi/Alabama shoreline.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama border, close to Biloxi MS

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA to Navarre, FL including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (metropolitan New Orleans); Storm Surge Warning from Port Fourchon, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas, Borgne and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out with a 19 % chance of 50-kt sustained winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas, including areas around the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches possible with isolated totals to 24 inches, producing life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting all marine approaches.
